title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: In a little I saw a hilltop which, by its broad, flat shape I knew forthe Black Mount, which lies above the village of Dolphinton on the wayto the west country.

title: Memorials of his time,
author: Cockburn, Henry Cockburn
snippet: It was then resolved to associate him with my schoolfellow Eichard Mackenzie of Dolphinton, a sensible and honourable man ; and a commission was issued in favor of them both.

title: Spare hours /
author: Brown, John
snippet: jtnd Robbie trudges off, arriving in the afternoon at the manse of Dolphinton.

title: Spare hours /
author: Brown, John
snippet: Robert Forsyth, the father of the advocate, and himself grave-digger, bellman,  and minister's man, was asked by his master, who was knowing in pigs, to take one of a very fine litter to his friend, the then minister of Dolphinton.

title: Spare hours /
author: Brown, John
snippet: Amid the dreary unreadable rubbish in this old bundle,  there is a most characteristic onslaught by the famous Dr. George Cheyne upon Dr. Oliphant, Dolphinton' s friend and defender ; it is his pugilistic, honest, reckless style, and is valuable for the testimony he (at this time) a free-thinker in religion, and a mathematical  and mechanical physician (he is defending Dr. Pit- cairn) gives to the strictly Divine origin of animal species.

title: Spare hours /
author: Brown, John
snippet: HUNDRED and ninety years ago, Dr. Andrew  Brown, the laird of Dolphinton, was a well-known and, indeed, famous man in Edinburgh,  and not unknown in London and the general medical world.
